intro: Tetrameranthus umbellatus, commonly known as the umbrella leaf plant, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage. Tetrameranthus umbellatus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and prefers partial to full sunlight.
